item.title: scikit-learn: Creating a matrix of named entity counts
item.description: >>> from polyglot.text import Text >>> doc = "My name is David Beckham. Hello from London, England" >>> Text(doc, hint_language_code="en").entities [I-PER(['David', 'Beckham']), I-LOC(['London']), I-LOC(['England'])] >>> ["_".join(entity) for entity in Text(doc, hint_language_code="en").entities] ['David_Beckham', 'London', 'England'] from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer from sklearn.naive_bayes import MultinomialNB from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline nlp_pipeline = Pipeline([ ('cv', CountVectorizer(), ('mnb', MultinomialNB()) ]) ... #Â Train and Test the model ... entities = {} def analyze(doc): if doc not in entities: entities[doc] = ["_".
